project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Summary
JIRA Software _Development Integration Plugin_ might create large number of *ListenableFutureAdapter* threads (10k+) and that cause JIRA to stall and crash. 

h3. Environment
 * Instances with a large amount of issues (1 million+) and linked to (D)VCS accounts.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create instances with a large amount of issues
 # Link to DVCS accounts with valid content (Bitbucket server or other)
 # Trigger web-hook _update-summary_ to update many issues (5k+) Dev-status 

h3. Expected Behavior
JIRA operates normally 

h3. Actual Behavior
If large number of issues are requested to update Dev-status, there will be large number *ListenableFutureAdapter* threads  and whole JIRA instance stalls and crashes. 

Other symptoms:
* High CPU utilizations
* High disk activity due to active Lucene reindexing. 

h3. Notes
* Thread dump collected during that time will show large number of *ListenableFutureAdapter* threads with following stack:
{noformat}
"ListenableFutureAdapter-thread-104090" #334429 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fad7867c000 nid=0x6d9a waiting on condition [0x00007fa9db473000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
        at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
        - parking to wait for  <0x00000005cf1b7fb0> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2039)
        at _hostname_19(LinkedBlockingQueue.java:350)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex.perform(QueueingIndex.java:74)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer$2.perform(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:198)
...
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:426)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssueObjects(DefaultIndexManager.java:455)
...
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.source.cache.DevSummaryStore.reIndex(DevSummaryStore.java:117)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.source.cache.CachingProviderDecorator$StoreValueInCache.apply(CachingProviderDecorator.java:321)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.source.cache.CachingProviderDecorator$StoreValueInCache.apply(CachingProviderDecorator.java:208)
        at com.google.common.util.concurrent.Futures$4.apply(Futures.java:503)
...
        at com.google.common.util.concurrent.JdkFutureAdapters$ListenableFutureAdapter$1.run(JdkFutureAdapters.java:152)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at _hostname_2(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}
* REST API webhooks {{/rest/dev-status/1.0/webhooks/update-summary}}

h3. Workaround
* Reduce number of webhooks call 
* Disable _Development Integration Plugin_  (com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus)
fields.summary: Development Integration Plugin might create large number of ListenableFutureAdapter threads

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Problem
Burndown charts rely on an issue to indicate when the chart data began. For example, the Epic Burndown chart will mark the first issue added as the starting point. All issue data/work after this "First Issue" will be considered as part of the Epic Burndown chart.

If the first ticket is transitioned from a "Done" status to another "Done" status, the Burndown chart will then believe it's part of the latest Active Sprint, suddenly ignoring all data before the active Sprint.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Agile project using the sample scrum data
** You'll notice that the sample data will create 2 sprints:  Sample Sprint 1 and Sample Sprint 2
** Sample Sprint 1 is already completed.
** Sample Sprint 2 is currently active.
# Create a new Epic for the board. Like "Epic1"
# JQL search for:
{code}
Sprint = "Sample Sprint 1" and status = "Done"
{code}
** These are the "Done" tickets in the first Sprint
# Edit this ticket to put it into "Epic1"
** For our example, let's say this is SSP-23
# Now, add a "Done" ticket into "Epic1" from "Sample Sprint 2"
** For our example, let's say this is SSP-15
# View the Epic Burndown Chart
** Notice how the chart shows data from both Sample Sprint 1 and Sample Sprint 2
 !Before Transition.png|thumbnail! 
# Now, open up SSP-23 and click on the "Done" transition again.
 !Done ticket transition.png|thumbnail! 
# View the Epic Burndown Chart
 !After transition.png|thumbnail! 
** Notice that Sample Sprint 1 is no longer shown on the chart
** Notice the issue list, SSP-23 is shown to be part of Sample Sprint 2
** If you view SSP-23, the issue view will still show Sample Sprint 1

h5. User Expectation
There was no actual change to the SSP-23's field values (sprint, resolution, or resolution date) and no work was done as all estimates have already been burned down. We would expect no change in the burndown chart.

h5. Actual Result
The burndown chart is different, no longer showing that "Sample Sprint 1" exists. Instead it now shows SSP-23 as part of "Sample Sprint 2".
* If you view SSP-23 ticket, it shows that it is part of "Sample Sprint 1", so the burndown chart is not showing actual Sprint data.

h5. Cause
When a ticket is transitioned to a status that sets the resolution, the burndown charts are assuming that the ticket is now part of the latest Sprint.

h5. Extra Notes
The above example is for the Epic Burndown, but this can happen for the Release Burndown as well.
fields.summary: Burndown Chart Data Corrupted By Multiple Done Transitions

h3. Summary

If there are more than 200 issues in specific Version and user tries to view the issues, JIRA will only display the first 200 issues without any option to view the rest of the issues for the Version in the Release page.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create 250 issues and assign a Fix Version.
# Open Release page and select the specific Version.
# Only the first 200 issues will be shown.


h3. Environment

* JIRA 7.4.2, 7.4.3


h3. Expected Results

JIRA shows the first 200 issues with the page options if there are more than 200 issues for the Version.


h3. Actual Results

JIRA only shows 200 issues for the specific version with no option to view the rest of the issues in the Version.


h3.Workaround

Click on the *View in Issue Navigator* in the Release -> Version page to view all the issues in the Issue Navigator.
fields.summary: Unable to view complete issues in Release page

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Create Branch Workflow trigger does not fire after the first time

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a workflow trigger that leverages the branch create action
# Create a branch named appropriately to cause the workflow trigger to be fired (in my example I used test-1-feature as my issue key was test-1)
# Observe that the workflow trigger fired successfully
# Now delete the branch we've just created, and set the issue back to the previous status
# Create a new branch with the same name used previously (eg. test-1-feature)

h3. Expected Results
The workflow trigger should fire again

h3. Actual Results
The workflow trigger does not fire

h3. Notes
From 6.3.11, JIRA applications automatically "dedupes" branch creation events when processing workflow triggers. This behaviour can be changed by setting the dark feature '_jira.plugin.devstatus.branchtrigger.process.duplicates_'.
See this KB entry: [How to disable deduping of branch creation events|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-disable-deduping-of-branch-creation-events-687020985.html]

h3.Workaround
Create a branch with a distinct new name and the workflow trigger will fire again.
fields.summary: Create Branch Workflow trigger does not fire after first time

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When there are broken avatar images for profiles (for example if you remove the images that were being pointed by avatar profiles or when not migrating the "data" folder from your {{jira-home}}), tickets that have the assignee with a broken avatar will appear with tooltips and tags over it, making the user struggling to see the ticket. (See attachment 1 and 2)
Also, the Assignee's avatar on the ticket view is replaced by the user's username, also causing formatting issues on the ticket. (See attachment 3).

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Delete the images from {{jira-home/data/avatars}}, or doesn't migrate the {{data}} folder when upgrading the instance
# On an Agile Backlog board, select a project where there will be tickets with the assignee being one user that has a broken avatar image.

h3. Expected Results
Set the default JIRA avatar to any user that have a broken avatar image (one that is pointing to a file that does not exist anymore), so that tickets appear normally and there are no formatting issues on the user's avatar image on the ticket view.

h3. Actual Results
On the board, the ticket will appear with tooltips tags all over it, and on the ticket view, the assignee avatar image will be replaced with the user's username causing formatting errors.

 !Attachment 4.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
# If you have upgrade or migrated your instance, remember to also migrate the {{data}} folder from your previous instance so attachments and avatars are also migrated.
# If you have deleted the avatars images, set the default image for every user on the instance, making sure there is no user pointing its avatar image to a non existent image.
fields.summary: Tooltip HTML tags overlay Agile Backlog board items and other formatting issues due to broken avatar images

h3. Summary

When user tries to edit the "User picker* custom field in the issue detail view, javascript error with the following message will be shown:
{quote}Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'scrollTop' of undefined
{quote}
Steps to reproduce
 # Create a customfield with *User Picker (multiple users)* option.
 # Associate the customfield to screen used by project.
 # Edit *Issue Detail View* of a board where the issues from project above are shown to include the *User Picker* customfield. (Board -> Configure Board -> Issue Detail View)
 # Click on the same issue from the backlog and from the issue detail view, try to edit the *User Picker* customfield.
 # Add multiple users to the *User Picker* customfield from issue page (must add at least 2 users.  If the field contains 0 or 1 user accounts, this error does not appear).

(i) Issue can also be replicated by opening full edit screen.
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.4.1 +
h3. Expected Results

No javascript error is shown when the custom field is edited.
h3. Actual Results

Either error will be thrown in the UI (that can be hidden by clicking on the X button):
- "Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'scrollTop' of undefined"
- "DetailsException: TypeError: t.responseContainer is undefined"

 !UserPickerIssue_Error2.png|thumbnail!

In some cases, we see the stack trace as:
{code:java}
DetailsException: TypeError: t.responseContainer is undefined
{code}

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, users are allowed to reorder Sprint which is specifically not started. The re-ordering can be done from the Backlog page. When the Sprint is started, the option to re-order will automatically be removed from the Sprint.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the Active Sprint to be re-ordered similar to the Sprint which is not started.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Allow reordering Active Sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When I am moving the incomplete issues to another sprint at the end of the former sprint, is there a way I can differentiate the issues as the spill over from the previous sprint. How can I differentiate the spill over issues from the planned issues. Kindly guide me and help me achieve it
fields.summary: Spill over issues from the Planned issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When user tries to search for quick filter in boards before issues are fully loaded, following Javascript error is shown:

+Google Chrome & Internet Explorer+

{quote}
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getIssueList' of null
{quote}

+Mozilla Firefox+

{quote}
Exception: TypeError: g.getBacklogModel2(...) is null
{quote}

Steps to reproduce:

# Open any board.
# Click on any quick filter option and at the same time, start typing in the search bar of quick filter (and enter) before the issues in board is fully loaded.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.4.3 & JIRA 7.3.5


h3. Expected Results

Javascript error is not shown when the searching for anything in quick filter search bar.


h3. Actual Results

Javascript error is shown when the searching for anything in quick filter search bar.


h3.Workaround

Before start searching in searchbar, wait for all the issues in board are fully loaded before.
fields.summary: JavaScript error when searching in quick filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Expected

When accessing a board, the vertical scroll bar is always displayed.

h3. Current Behaviour

The sprint panel overshadows the scroll bar, and if the number of tickets in the board is big enough, completely blocks it's view.

h3. Workaround

Mouse scrolling works and will scroll the page up and down even though the bar is hidden.
fields.summary: Board vertical scroll bar obscured by the sprint panel

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: As a JIRA admin, I'd like to be able to integrate JIRA with Cardboard (https://cardboardit.com).
fields.summary: JIRA and Carboard integration

fields.description:
Project imports can fail when issues are referencing non-existent Sprints, see here:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/project-import-fails-with-unexpected-import-failure-sprint-value-816686500.html

JIRA should check to and fix these invalid references. Maybe via the integrity checker or during the backup export.
fields.summary: JIRA should Check if Tickets are Referencing a Sprint that does not Exist

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For Label and Assignee fields (for example), when you inline edit these fields and save the value by pointing the mouse anywhere in the screen, the value gets saved. But this is not happening for Estimate field.
[^board.png]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Boards > Select and Board and navigate to Backlog
# Click on any issue
# On the right side panel is the issue detail section
# Inline edit the Estimate field
# Once the value has been entered, point the mouse anywhere in the screen

h3. Expected Behaviour
The value will be saved like how it works for Assignee and Label fields.

h3. Actual Behaviour
The value doesn't get saved

h3. Workaround
Click on the Estimate field and after keying in the value, click on the *Check* button to save the value.
fields.summary: In line Edit for Estimate field does not get Saved when pointing the Mouse anywhere in the Screen

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA does not have specific permission that be configured to control group which is allowed to create Agile board. The "Create Shared Objects" in Global permission allows JIRA Administrator to control users who are able to create new board with new filter but even if the user does not have the "Create Shared Objects* permission, they can still create board with the remaining 2 options which are creating boards from:

# Existing projects
# Existing filter


h3. Suggested Solution

Add another permission in Global permission to allow Administrator to configure group which are allowed to create new boards.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Limit group with permission to create Agile board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in the Software board's you can one drag and drop issues to columns one at a time. It is not possible to select several at one go. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for multiple issue drag drop on the board. 

h3. Why this is important
This is a more efficient way to work on the board
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to drag and drop multiple issues on the board at the same time

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
+*Current behavior*+

From documentation on creating a board [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver074/creating-a-board-889531204.html] : "you will need the JIRA 'Create Shared Objects' global permission before you can create a board. If you don't have this permission you can still create a board, but it will not be visible to other people as its filter will not be shared."
h3. +*Suggestion*+
 - Can we review the design and ensure that if user does not have "Create Shared Objects" permission, we should prevent permission to create a board even via Board > View All Boards > Create Board.
 - Or can we have more granularity of board creation permission, currently the permission is determine only by "Create Shared Objects" permission.
fields.summary: Inconsistency with 'Create Shared Objects' global permission required to create rapid boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Presently you're only able to view a pie chart sectioned across a single dimension (e.g., *component*). You have no simple means to compare values across other  dimensions (e.g., *assignee*, *priority*) as you can't visualize these in a single chart.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the capability to create a multi-level (or nested) pie chart, as per the attached example. This would allow you section a single chart across multiple categories.

 !chart_pie_all.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
Presently you can only view data for a single sectoring dimension. It would be very helpful to visualize this data cross multiple dimensions.
fields.summary: Enhancement: Nested (or multi-level) pie chart in pie chart report

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
* The Quick view Attachment(paperclip) icon (from JIRA Software) used to show the attachment count in JIRA 7.1.9. Starting 7.2.1 it does not show the item count anymore. This change is not documented in the release notes of JIRA Software versions 7.1 or 7.2.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Software project
# Select the backlog
# Select an issue from the backlog.

h5. Expected Behavior
* The issue is displayed, with the attachment (paperclip) icon showing the item count.
!Issue  quick view7.1.9.png|thumbnail!

h5. Actual Behavior
* The issue is displayed, with the attachment (paperclip) icon not showing any item count.
!Issue  quick view7.2.1.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Cause
* Unknown.

h5. Workaround
* None known

h5. Notes: 
* Tested in Chrome 60.0.3112.101 (Official Build) (64-bit) in Windows 10.
* The behavior is also present in JIRA 7.4.0
fields.summary: The Quick view Attachment(paperclip) icon (from JIRA Software) does not show the item count anymore

fields.description:
h3. Summary
LexoRank rebalancing job may stuck in some cases. You don't see any progress for many hours (days). 
You can see status at Lexorank management page (see [LexoRank Management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/lexorank-management-779159218.html])

* Example of REST call {{/rest/greenhopper/1.0/lexorank/balance}} output:
{noformat}
{"lexoRankBalancingServiceStatus":
{"balancingDisabled":false,"balancingSuspended":false,"balanceHandlerRunning":true},
"lexoRankBalancerStatus":{"balancerLocked":true,
"perFieldStatus":[{"fieldName":"Rank","fieldId":11080,"numRankedIssues":2846758,"percentComplete":98.12,
"distribution":[2793228,0,53530]}]},
"totalIssueCount":2846034}
{noformat}
* Note progress stuck at 98%. 
* Please note that JSWSERVER-15703 introduces the back-off mechanism for JIRA DC, so this is expected that Lexorank Rebancing pauses under high load: 
bq. Whenever we detect current node is behind any other node in the cluster by 30 seconds or any other node in the cluster is behind current node by 30 seconds, LexoRank balancing will back-off. 

h3. Expected Results
Lexorank Rebalancing job is running and has progress. 

h3. Actual Results
Lexorank Rebalancing job is stuck and has no progress. 
+User impact:+ Lexorank Rebalancing fixes issues with "broken" Rank, if current progress did not fix those broken issues so far, user will not able to rank them. 
 
h3. Notes
* Thread dump generated at that time will show the *lexorank-executor-thread-0* is WAITING for a long time:
{noformat}
lexorank-executor-thread-0" #544 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f331c11a800 nid=0xaff5 waiting on condition [0x00007f3236dca000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00007f3706dffcc8> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2039)
	at java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue.put(LinkedBlockingQueue.java:350)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.balance.LexoRankBalancer.balanceFieldId(LexoRankBalancer.java:363)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.balance.LexoRankBalancer.lambda$balanceFieldIds$1(LexoRankBalancer.java:112)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.balance.LexoRankBalancer.dt_access$782(LexoRankBalancer.java)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.balance.LexoRankBalancer$$dtt$$Lambda$1518/708308671.run(Unknown Source)

{noformat}
* Enabling  _DEBUG_ logging Lexorank balance (_com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.balance_) doesn't show any progress

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Similar to JSWSERVER-12257 we'd like the ability to set a timeout limit, however we would like this for queries in general. Unfortunately JIRA lets users do silly queries which can several take minutes or more to run.

Although this would impact the user running the query, setting a hard limit would help prevent these users impacting others. Especially in cases where users do not realise the query is still running, and refresh or change pages.
fields.summary: Ability to set a query timeout (in JIRA config not DB)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

When JIRA is integrated with Bitbucket Cloud using DVCS, currently 2 POST services will be created in Bitbucket Repo Settings -> Services, one to send Commits updates and one to send Pull Requests updates to JIRA:

!service.png|thumbnail!

These 2 services use the same REST endpoint:
{code:java}
<JIRA_Base_URL>/rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/<Repo_ID>/sync{code}
(-) In the future, Webhooks will replace Services, however currently it seems JIRA DVCS fails to update Commits sent by Bitbucket Cloud Webhooks.
h3. +Steps to reproduce+
 # Integrate JIRA with Bitbucket Cloud
 # Go to Bitbucket Repo Settings -> Services -> copy the URL (as above)
 # Delete the services (the Services menu will disappear if there's no more service)
 (i) This is to ensure only Webhooks will take effect
 # Go to Bitbucket Repo Settings -> Webhooks -> create a new Webhook like this (use the URL from step 2 & ensure Commit (Repository) Push and Pull Request Created are selected as triggers):
 !webhook.png|thumbnail!
 # Make a new Commit mentioning a JIRA issue key in the commit message
 # Create a Pull Request mentioning the same JIRA issue key in the pull request title

h3. +Expected behavior+

Both the Commit and Pull Request appear immediately in the Development Panel of the JIRA issue.
h3. +Actual behavior+

Only the Pull Request appears. The Commit doesn't appear until JIRA manually syncs the repo.
h3. +Suspected Cause+

(x) The following logs are seen when Commits are sent to JIRA:
{code:java}
2017-08-24 06:30:38,593 http-nio-8080-exec-19 INFO anonymous 390x1135x1 - 104.192.143.193 /rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/1/sync [c.a.j.p.d.r.external.v1.RepositoryResource] Pull Request Postcommit hook started synchronization for repository [1].
2017-08-24 06:30:38,594 http-nio-8080-exec-19 DEBUG anonymous 390x1135x1 - 104.192.143.193 /rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/1/sync [c.a.j.p.d.r.external.v1.RepositoryResource] Rest request to soft sync pull requests for repository [1] with type [push]{code}
Looks like it tries to update Pull Requests instead, with a conflicting type:
{code:java}
Rest request to soft sync pull requests for repository [1] with type [push]{code}
(/) The following logs are seen when Pull Requests are sent to JIRA:
{code:java}
2017-08-24 06:32:25,865 http-nio-8080-exec-19 INFO anonymous 392x1150x1 - 104.192.143.194 /rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/1/sync [c.a.j.p.d.r.external.v1.RepositoryResource] Pull Request Postcommit hook started synchronization for repository [1].
2017-08-24 06:32:25,865 http-nio-8080-exec-19 DEBUG anonymous 392x1150x1 - 104.192.143.194 /rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/1/sync [c.a.j.p.d.r.external.v1.RepositoryResource] Rest request to soft sync pull requests for repository [1] with type [pullrequest]{code}
h3. +Notes+

From Bitbucket Cloud Webhooks logs, the Webhook requests are triggered with the correct types and payloads (request body):

!log.png|thumbnail!
h3. +Workaround+

(+) Use Services instead of Webhooks.

1. If the Services menu is missing, run this curl command to activate it:
{code:java}
curl -X POST -u <username>:<password> https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/<username>/<repository_name>/services/ -d "type=POST&URL=https%3A%2F%2Fbitbucket.org/post"{code}
 * Replace Bitbucket username, password, and repository name accordingly.

2. From the Services menu, add these 2 services:
 * POST
 * Pull Request POST

For both services, use the Webhook URL: 
{code:java}
<JIRA_Base_URL>/rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/<Repo_ID>/sync{code}
3. Deactivate the Webhook
fields.summary: JIRA DVCS fails to update Commits sent by Bitbucket Cloud Webhooks

fields.summary: 500 Error on any Jira issue, Mobile Responsive

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Environment
JIRA 7.4.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create issue collector for a project with "Discrete" as the render option.
2. Copy the code, paste it into the announcement banner field.
3. Navigate to the detail page of an issue. 

h3. Expected Results
The collector link would render to the left of the scrollbar, as it correctly does on pages such as dashboards, settings pages, and the issue search page.


h3. Actual Results
The link renders on top of the scrollbar which blocks the down arrow button. See screenshot.

 
h3. Notes
The issue can be reproduced on OS X and Windows, with the latest versions of Chrome, Firefox, and Safari.

h3.Workaround
No present workaround.
fields.summary: "Discrete" issue collector link renders on top of scrollbar when viewing certain pages

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Releases tab on the JIRA project show the correct release date

The detailed view of the release shows the INCORRECT date

The Macro plug-in on confluence shows the INCORRECT date

 

We are not sure why there is this inconsistency.  We noticed this issue about 1 week ago.
fields.summary: Release dates are inconsistent; 1-day off on various views

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
All users are able to create their own boards which might cause instances to be filled with boards, some of them no longer being used, outdated, orphaned, etc. An administrator has no way to identify these boards if he/she intends to clean up the instance

h3. Suggestion
Create a page/tool which will return each boards usage which the admins can refer to. This will help admins manage their instance and delete boards which are no longer used
fields.summary: Retrieve usage information of boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When upgrading JIRA to 7.2+ the database columns with data type {{VARCHAR}} will not be changed to {{NVARCHAR}}. This might trigger JSWSERVER-15917.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4 upgraded to 7.2+
* Microsoft SQL Server 2012 or 2014.
* 1M+ issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upgrade a JIRA instance from 6.4 to 7.2 or higher.

h3. Expected Results
Columns data types are changed from {{VARCHAR}} to {{NVARCHAR}}.

h3. Actual Results
Columns remain at {{VARCHAR}}.

h3. Notes
Causes JSWSERVER-15917.

h3. Workaround
Example of workaround for {{AO_60DB71_LEXORANK}} table. Similar approach can be done for other tables. 

# Stop JIRA.
# Backup your database.
# Delete all indexes from the table {{AO_60DB71_LEXORANK}}, *except for the primary key*.
# Change the data type on the columns {{AO_60DB71_LEXORANK.RANK}} and {{AO_60DB71_LEXORANK.LOCK_HASH}} using these SQL queries:
{code:sql}
ALTER TABLE dbo.AO_60DB71_LEXORANK ALTER COLUMN RANK NVARCHAR(255) NOT NULL;
ALTER TABLE dbo.AO_60DB71_LEXORANK ALTER COLUMN LOCK_HASH NVARCHAR(255) NULL;
{code}
# Run the following SQL queries to flush caches and update statistics on the database:
{code:sql}
DBCC FREEPROCCACHE;
SP_UPDATESTATS;
{code}
# Start JIRA. The indexes for the table {{AO_60DB71_LEXORANK}} will be automatically recreated.

This duplicates JRASERVER-59816
fields.summary: There is no upgrade task to change columns from VARCHAR to NVARCHAR when using SQL Server

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

Currently the API call */rest/bitbucket/1.0/repositories* is run every 20 seconds when the DVCS Accounts page is active. The purpose is to check which repos are linked and which are not, among all the repos that have been synced into JIRA. This check will determine which repos are displayed (the linked ones), and which repos are searchable (the unlinked).

If there're too many repos (~5k), this will cause a performance issue when searching for repos, especially when a call can't complete within 20 seconds (when the next call kicks in). Other than that, all the repos are retrieved and displayed without a pagination scheme.
h3. +Suggestions+
 # The API call should be relaxed. It's not necessary to have it run every 20 seconds.
 # The repos should be paginated.

h3. +Workaround+

If it's not necessary to sync all the repos into JIRA, create a dedicated DVCS account that has access to only those necessary repos, then use that account to integrate JIRA with DVCS. This applies to both Bitbucket Cloud and Github.
fields.summary: DVCS repository check should be relaxed and the repos should be paginated

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,
 Steps to reproduce the situation:
 1. the group "abc" was created
 2. the group was chosen in user filtering for the custom field "xy" and checked enable group or project role filtering
 3. after a while the group was deleted
 4. noone knew / remembered anymore the group was chosen in user filtering for the custom field

Problem: the deleted group couldn't be seen anymore in the application (in user filtering for the custom field), but it was left - I found it in the database in the table "jiraschema.userpickerfiltergroup"
 Quick workaround: when picked another group in the user filtering for the custom field - the record wasn't anymore in the database
 Please help:
 why isn't it deleted automatically (if it isn't a bug, it would be useful to understand the principle, so we could know what to expect and be careful to prevent various problems)?
 how to find where is some configuration element used?
 how to quickly find all unused configuration elements?
 Database type: mssql
 Jira version: 7.3.1.
 Could you help, please?

I couldn't save this as a bug - "User 'nena.kruljac' doesn't have the 'Assign Issues' permission", and I don't see assign anywhere.

Best regards, Nena
fields.summary: group deleted, but left in database, although not seen anymore in user filtering for the custom field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The JSON import fails to complete if the case of any of the status from the JSON file doesn't match the case of the corresponding status in the Project Workflow.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Create a Workflow in a JIRA instance (for example 7.4.1) that contains a status "ON HOLD"
 - Create a JSON file containing an issue that has the status "On Hold" in the history. For example:
{noformat}
{
    "author": "c1111",
    "created": "2014-05-31T18:00:00.000+0200",
    "items": [
        {
            "fieldType": "jira",
            "field": "status",
            "fromString": "On Hold",
            "toString": "On Hold"
        }
    ]
}
{noformat}

 - Attempt to import the JSON file.

h3. Expected Results

 
 * The import should complete successfully without any error despite the case difference between the statuses "On Hold" and "ON HOLD", since JIRA doesn't allow two statuses which differ only in casing (JIRA statuses are case insensitive)
 * The issue should be imported with its complete history
 * For now, until this issue is resolved, we might want to modify the [JSON import documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/importing-data-from-json-802592907.html] 
 ** to reflect the fact that the import is currently case sensitive
 ** to let the JIRA users know that the status case should match between the JSON file and the statuses defined in the JIRA instance where the import is performed 

h3. Actual Results

The history of this issue is not completely imported (all the history is imported up to the status change to "On Hold").
 The import page reports the error "Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data may be in an unstable state".

The generic error below can be found in the import log:
{noformat}
2017-08-04 10:45:17,076 ERROR - Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data may be in an unstable state
java.util.NoSuchElementException
    at com.google.common.collect.AbstractIterator.next(AbstractIterator.java:154)
    at com.google.common.collect.Iterators.find(Iterators.java:717)
    at com.google.common.collect.Iterables.find(Iterables.java:646)
    at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.systemfields.StatusHistoryItemHandler.mapValue(StatusHistoryItemHandler.java:39)
    at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.AbstractHistoryItemValueMapper.mapValueWhenApplicable(AbstractHistoryItemValueMapper.java:32)
    at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.AbstractHistoryItemValueMapper.rewriteHistoryItem(AbstractHistoryItemValueMapper.java:13)
    at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.OfBizHistoryImporter.importHistory(OfBizHistoryImporter.java:88)
    at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.createIssue(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:994)
    at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importIssues(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:797)
    at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.doImport(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:414)
    at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:26)
    at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:15)
    at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:458)
    at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:426)
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
    at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
    at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:216)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}
h3. Solution / Workaround

Make sure that all the statuses from the JSON file match the statuses (with the same case) defined in the JIRA instance where the import is performed.
 Taking the example provided above, the history should be changed as follows:
{noformat}
{
    "author": "c1111",
    "created": "2014-05-31T18:00:00.000+0200",
    "items": [
        {
            "fieldType": "jira",
            "field": "status",
            "fromString": "ON HOLD",
            "toString": "ON HOLD"
        }
    ]
}
{noformat}
fields.summary: The JSON import fails to complete if the case of any of the status from the JSON file doesn't match the case of the corresponding status in the Project Workflow

fields.description:
Allow multiple versions to be added by dragging issues on the backlog

h3. Problem Definition

When dragging issues in the Backlog through different versions, the previous version will be removed from the issue and only the new version will be present on the *Fix Version* field. However, if you navigate to the issue, you are able to input more than one version into the field.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add an option so that dragging issues through versions doesn't removes the previous version on the issue.

h3. Why this is important
 
It allows for easier management of versions when stories spread across multiple versions.

h3. Workaround 

Add the multiple versions through the issue view.
fields.summary: Allow multiple versions to be added by dragging issues on the backlog

h4. Summary

When I was moving some tickets into a different column in my sprint, I saw some "Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'top' of null" exceptions.
h4. Steps to reproduce
 * Remove the "Schedule Issue" project permission from a user and attempt to move an issue with this user between columns
 * Use a board that does not have ranking enabled, for example "ORDER BY rank ASC" instead of "ORDER BY Rank ASC"

h4. Expected Result
an error message will be thrown indicating a missing permission or a misconfigured board

h4. Actual Result
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'top' of null
 is thrown
h4. Workaround
* Ensure users have the Schedule Issue project permission
* Ensure the board in use has ranking properly enabled
fields.summary: Uncaught TypeError thrown in the UI when moving issues between columns on a board

fields.description:
This is a continuation of JSWSERVER-11775 where the majority of the timeouts appear to be prevented JIRA Server 7.2.7 and there is a new user friendly message created for users.

However, there still appears to be some scenarios where this timeout is hit. 

{quote}With release of 7.2.7 (server) we will change the behaviour of the quick release window (a bit).
If the release process takes longer than expected and the initial request times out - it will result with a new and more informative message:

The link provided ("1 issue" in the example above) should open the issue navigator filtered to a release version so that one can see if all tasks have already been processed properly.
Due to the nature of the release process in some extreme edge cases it MAY happen that the release takes more than just "few" seconds. During this time - it may happen that not all tasks will "vanish" from initial Kanban Board or the released list (from link provided) may look incomplete. The process - though - will continue in the background and all tasks will get processed and properly marked in the system, eventually.
The team is aware of this situation and we have already focused on performance issues around the release cycle. 
For majority of situations, though, the process should not take more than "few" seconds and simply "reloading the board" as the new message suggests should show final state of the board.
I hope this will ease the confusion mentioned in the OP at least a bit {quote}


This is being opened as an attempt to track these extreme edge cases that MAY happen where the release takes more than just "few" seconds, triggering the timeout.
fields.summary: Performance improvements to prevent timeout errors when releasing a large amount of issues from a Kanban board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When upgrading JIRA to 7.4.x, where the Kanban backlog feature was introduced, there are cases where multiple backlog columns are created, needing to be deleted directly in the database.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upgrade a JIRA instance containing a Kanban board to 7.4.x
# Access the board in the affected instance
 
h3. Expected Results

JIRA will display just one backlog column

h3. Actual Results

JIRA will display multiple backlog columns.

h3.Workaround

# Stop JIRA
# Run the following query to identify the affected entries: {code:sql}SELECT * FROM "AO_60DB71_COLUMN" where "RAPID_VIEW_ID" = (select "ID" from "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW" where "NAME" = 'YOUR_BOARD_NAME');{code}
# Multiple columns with the gh.kanplan.column@name=gh.workflow.preset.backlog name will show up. Proceed keeping the one with the lowest id, then delete the other ones.
# Start JIRA
fields.summary: Multiple Kanban Backlog columns can appear when upgrading JIRA to 7.4.x

fields.description:
In 7.3, JIRA added the ability to grant Project Admins the rights to edit their own workflows:
{quote}
h2. Project level administration

We've extended the project administrators permission, so that project administrators can now [edit their projects workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver073/workflows-861256323.html] under certain conditions:
 * The workflow must not be shared with any other projects
 * The workflow cannot be the JIRA default system workflow, which cannot be edited at all

The project admins will not be able to edit the workflow to the same extent as a JIRA administrator. The restrictions are:
 * To add a status, the status must already exist in the JIRA instance i.e. the project admin can't create new statuses or edit existing statuses
 * The project admin isn't allowed to delete a status from the workflow
 * The project admin can create, update or delete transitions, but they can't select or update a screen used by the transition, or edit a transition's properties, conditions, validators or post-functions

This feature is enabled by default. When you upgrade to JIRA Software 7.3, all your project administrators will have access to this feature immediately. To edit a workflow, a project administrator should select *Project settings* in their project's sidebar, and select an issue type. This will present the workflow, and *Edit Workflow* will be available.
{quote}
 
My question is, if one user has project admin on multiple projects, and a workflow is shared between only projects where the user has admin rights, can we grant them the ability to edit this workflow?
 
This would be in line with how software boards work in terms of starting/stopping sprints if the board contains issues from multiple projects.
fields.summary: Project admin shared workflow access

h4. Summary of Issue

If a user selects a *Released Version* in "Fix Version/s" (or a field that is based on the Version Picker), it should throw an Error and prompt the user with something like:

"Cannot tag the issue to an already released version. Please select an ongoing release version."

h4. How to reproduce

# Create a Version on the JIRA Board
# Add some issues and "Release" the Version
# When creating new tickets, the user is able to select a version already released in the "Fix Version/s" field.

h4. Expected Result

The system should not allow selection of a version already Released in "Fix Version/s".

h4. Actual Result

JIRA is allowing the end user to choose a Version that is already released as the "Fix Version/s".

h4. Additional notes

For custom fields based on the Version Picker, that custom field would not a flag with something like "do not allow selection of released version".

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60414].
  {panel}

h3. *Issue Summary*

When a user creates a sub-task, it is expected to inherit the parent issues components however since JIRA 7.1.X this stopped being so.

h3. *Steps to replicate*
# Craete a test project.
# Create components for this project.
# Add the component field to the view/edit screen.
# Create an issue in the test project.
# Assign components to this issue.
# Create a sub task for the issue using {{More > Create Sub-Task}}

h3. *Expected Result*
JIRA would create the sub-task and it would inherit the components of it's parent issue.

h3. *Actual Result*
JIRA creates the sub-task but clears out the component field.

h3. Notes
* Same problem for _Versions_ from parent issue. 
* This is undocumented feature (see JSWSERVER-11784) and specific to Software (Agile) projects. 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Sub Task in Software project doesn't inherit Parent components

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When user adds a component field and the component does not belong to the referenced project in the board filter, the filter will become complex query even though the filter is configured to retrieve issues from specific projects.

This prevents user has Manage Sprint permission in the project listed in the board filter from starting/completing Sprint.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a filter like:
{code}
project = "Sample Scrum Project" AND component = "Active Directory" ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}
** Ensure that the component "Active Directory" does not exist for "Sample Scrum Project". Instead have it exist for a different project
# Create a board with filter above.
# Access the board configuration and the "Project in board" will refer the filter as "The projects in this board cannot be listed because of the complexity of the board filter"


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.4.1, 7.1.6


h3. Expected Results

JIRA retrieves issues from specific project listed in the board filter.


h3. Actual Results

JIRA retrieves issues from all projects which caused the board filter to be recognized as a complex query.


h3.Workaround
# Ensure that the component belongs to the listed project
# Remove the component field from the board filter or
# Add the users who should be able to Manage Sprint to Manage Sprint permission in all Permission Scheme available in JIRA.
fields.summary: Adding "Component" field in board filter makes it complex filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The vertical scrollbar and its slider are being hidden by backlog and/or sprint header in JIRA Software 7.4.x
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Software 7.4.x
 * 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a test Scrum or Kanban board with sample data
 # Go the backlog for this board
 # If the board has a lot of issues, then the scrollbar won't actually be visible at all to the users
 # You can resize the browser window in order to see this better and to play with this, but JIRA shouldn't be obscuring this from the page view

h3. Expected Results

JIRA Software should be displaying the entire scrollbar when applicable. You should be able to see the entire scroll piece to know what part of the page you are on at any given time.
h3. Actual Results

The scrollbar, and its slider, can be completely or partially obscured by the backlog header on the page. (see screenshot)

!disappearing-scroll.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * This is not reproducible in JIRA 7.3.6 or earlier versions in my testing.
 * I was able to repro this with JIRA 7.4.0 and in 7.4.2 in both latest Firefox 54.0.1 and latest Chrome 59.0.3071.115 versions
 * Customer also reported this problem in 7.4.1
 * Reportedly IE does display this correctly.

h3. Workaround
 * Focus the backlog (by clicking anything inside it, like the sprint header or issues) and scroll using mouse weel/touchpad/arrow keys
 * Click on the sidebar below the header, this will bring the scrollbar to clicked position making it visible

*Update*: 
 You can toggle the sticky header feature on and off for the instance at 
 {{Settings > Applications > Jira software Configuration> Sticky sprint headers}}
 The feature will be on by default. You can turn the  feature off to get the behavior prior to 7.4 releases, which will keep the scrollbar visible. 

(i) Turning off "Sticky sprint headers" will prevent users who are using Firefox from being able to find entries in the backlog by using "CTRL + F" shortcut.
fields.summary: Scrollbar and its slider are being hidden by backlog and/or sprint header in JIRA 7.4.x

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Problem
If a ticket is closed before a Sprint starts, the Velocity Chart will still add those Story Points to "Commitment".  This behaviour is not the same for Sprint / Burndown Charts, which will see the ticket, but indicate that the ticket is starting with no Story Points

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a Sprint and add tickets to Sprint
* Close a ticket before the Sprint start
* Start the Sprint
* Complete the Sprint

h5. Expected Behaviour
As the ticket was closed before Sprint start, no Story Points should counted towards that Sprint

h5. Actual Behaviour
Velocity Chart is still counting the Story Points of the closed ticket.
fields.summary: Velocity Chart adds Story Points to Commitment Even if Ticket was Closed Before Sprint Start

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The period "." shortcut key does not function on *Agile Board* > *Issues* view if inline editing is disabled for an instance.
h3. Environment

Tested in stock JIRA 7.3.6.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Disable Inline Editing via *Administration* > *System* > *Edit Settings* > *Inline edit*.
 2. Load an Agile Board.
 3. Click the *Issues* link in the sidebar.
 4. Type the period "." key to bring up the quick menu.
h3. Expected Results

The keyboard shortcut should continue to function regardless of whether inline editing is enabled or disabled. The shortcut works on all other views/screens as expected. The period "." shortcut is the ONLY keyboard shortcut affected.
h3. Actual Results

The following error is observed in the Developer console in the browser:

{code}
 batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&healthcheck-resources=true&is-server-instance=true&is-sy…:2356 Uncaught TypeError: h.getFields is not a function at [http://localhost:8080/s/913961f4883a9abdadb6259761055c97-CDN/8z2imz/73017/9]…d=true&nps-not-opted-out=true&richediton=true&user-logged-in=true:2356:437 at [http://localhost:8080/s/515da348f187d5f89c7b5e225e1a2727-CDN/8z2imz/73017/9]…9eedc801e/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/batch.js?locale=en-US:3460:646 at Array.map (native) at Function.b.map.b.collect ([http://localhost:8080/s/515da348f187d5f89c7b5e225e1a2727-CDN/8z2imz/73017/9]…9eedc801e/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/batch.js?locale=en-US:1140:420) at b.(anonymous function) [as map] ([http://localhost:8080/s/515da348f187d5f89c7b5e225e1a2727-CDN/8z2imz/73017/9]…9eedc801e/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/batch.js?locale=en-US:1163:360) at Class.show ([http://localhost:8080/s/515da348f187d5f89c7b5e225e1a2727-CDN/8z2imz/73017/9]…9eedc801e/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/batch.js?locale=en-US:3460:617) at eval (eval at _executer ([http://localhost:8080/s/515da348f187d5f89c7b5e225e1a2727-CDN/8z2imz/73017/9]…eedc801e/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/batch.js?locale=en-US:3955:4328), <anonymous>:2:55) at main ([http://localhost:8080/s/515da348f187d5f89c7b5e225e1a2727-CDN/8z2imz/73017/9]…b9eedc801e/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/batch.js?locale=en-US:19:3721) at [http://localhost:8080/s/515da348f187d5f89c7b5e225e1a2727-CDN/8z2imz/73017/9]…b9eedc801e/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/batch.js?locale=en-US:19:4544
{code}

h3. Workaround

Re-enabling inline editing restores the shortcut key functionality.
fields.summary: Period "." shortcut does not work on "Agile Board > Issues" view if inline editing is disabled

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h1. Description:

Using right click->Send to Top of Backlog is sending the issue to the bottom of backlog if there was a subtask of that issue on the top of the backlog.
h1. Steps to reproduce:
h4. Setup:
 * There is at least one issue in the backlog
 * There is one issue on the To Do list. It has a subtask on the top of the backlog

h4. Steps:
 * right click on the issue in the To Do list and select Send To Top of Backlog

h1. Expected results:

The issue lands on the top of the backlog, its subtask is placed just below it.
h1. Observed:

The issue and its subtask are moved to the bottom of the backlog

Notes:

The scenario works correctly if the issue is dragged and dropped on the top of the backlog.
fields.summary: Kanban: send issue to top of backlog fails if its subtask is on the top of backlog

fields.description:
JIRA is currently not offered with any standard OS packaging, and makes life difficult for admins.

The attached SRPM provides both an RPM spec file and init script for JIRA.

The atlassian-jira-software-7.4.1.tar.gz download is compressed twice for some reason - gunzip the file until the raw tar file remains, and place the raw tar file atlassian-jira-software-7.4.1.tar into the SOURCES directory. Build the final RPM by running "rpmbuild -bb atlassian-jira-software.spec".
fields.summary: [Patch] RPM support for JIRA Software (v7.4.1)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In JIRA Software's Release Burndown there's a scenario explained below which will cause issues that fulfil certain condition and does not belong to Sprint in the report to be shown in the specific Sprint in the Release Burndown report:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/using-a-board/using-reports/viewing-the-release-burndown

{panel}*In the 'Completed Issues' table, why are some issues grouped into sprints that they are not assigned to?*

In the 'Completed Issues' table, an issue is grouped into a sprint if its completion date falls after the start date of the sprint and before the start date of the next sprint, regardless of whether it was assigned to the sprint during planning.

For example, consider the following sample data:
* Sprint 1 — starts on July 1 and ends on July 14
* Sprint 2 — starts on July 17 and ends on July 30

Say issue 'ABC-123' was assigned to Sprint 1 during planning but was not completed until July 18. In the 'Completed Issues' table, ABC-123 would be grouped under Sprint 2, rather than Sprint 1. This is a more accurate reflection of what happened during the release and helps maintain the integrity of the report data.
{panel}

For some users this is not a desirable behaviour since the issues were not worked on the Sprint that's reported in Release Burndown.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add an option to the Project Administrator/lead or JIRA Administrator to prevent the issues from being grouped in the Sprint where the issues never added before.

h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Prevent 'Completed Issues' that fulfills certain condition from shown in Release Burndown Reports
